definition: to hack/to chop/to split open/(of lightning) to strike

sentences.english: He spent the whole morning splitting wood.
sentences.chinese: 他一整个上午都在劈柴。

sentences.english: I see a bundle of firewood on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 我看见了一捆劈柴在地板上。

sentences.english: Crumple a few sheets into balls and place them in with piles of kindling.
sentences.chinese: 将报纸弄皱攒成球状，把它们和劈柴放在一起。

sentences.english: I set myself the task of chopp up the firewood.
sentences.chinese: 我给自己安排了劈柴的任务。

sentences.english: He might specify the coal-cellar and the woodhouse.
sentences.chinese: 他可以特别提出贮煤室和劈柴房来。

sentences.english: The boys chopped wood, splitting the enormous logs in the woodshed into manageable pieces.
sentences.chinese: 男人在劈柴，他把柴棚里的原木劈成小块。

sentences.english: Be sure to use with the wood axe for some old-fashioned wood fire grill and wash thoroughly before using it for meals.
sentences.chinese: 请务必在用斧头劈柴烧火做饭前，把它清洗干净。

sentences.english: After enlightenment n chop wood, carry water.
The paper burns fast and hot, giving the kindling a good start.
sentences.chinese: 纸张燃烧很快并且很热，可以让劈柴开始很好的燃烧。

sentences.english: He chopped wood to make the fire, dug and weeded the little vegetable patch.
sentences.chinese: 他劈柴，生火，在小菜园里松土并锄草。

definition: to light a fire for cooking
to make a fire/to light a fire
to chop wood/to chop down trees
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
